column3: I had an excellent math and physics teacher in high school named T.C. Patel, and in the university, I had truly dedicated professors in both physics and mathematics who gave me a sound foundation with which to pursue graduate studies.
The task of the modern educator is not to cut down jungles, but to irrigate deserts.
I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet, strange, I am ungrateful to those teachers.
That is the difference between good teachers and great teachers: good teachers make the best of a pupil's means; great teachers foresee a pupil's ends.
We discovered that education is not something which the teacher does, but that it is a natural process which develops spontaneously in the human being.

Teaching is the only major occupation of man for which we have not yet developed tools that make an average person capable of competence and performance. In teaching we rely on the 'naturals', the ones who somehow know how to teach.
We spend the first twelve months of our children's lives teaching them to walk and talk and the next twelve telling them to sit down and shut up.
Your best teacher is your last mistake.

None of us got where we are solely by pulling ourselves up by our bootstraps. We got here because somebody - a parent, a teacher, an Ivy League crony or a few nuns - bent down and helped us pick up our boots.
A professor is someone who talks in someone else's sleep.
The smarter the journalists are, the better off society is. For to a degree, people read the press to inform themselves - and the better the teacher, the better the student body.
I had a terrible education. I attended a school for emotionally disturbed teachers.
I am indebted to my father for living, but to my teacher for living well.
I would suggest that teachers show their students concrete examples of the negative effects of the actions that gangsta rappers glorify.
Every child should have a caring adult in their lives. And that's not always a biological parent or family member. It may be a friend or neighbor. Often times it is a teacher.

Study how water flows in a valley stream, smoothly and freely between the rocks. Also learn from holy books and wise people. Everything - even mountains, rivers, plants and trees - should be your teacher.
Students rarely disappoint teachers who assure them in advance that they are doomed to failure.
Nearly everyone I met, worked with, or read about was my teacher, one way or another.
You know how to tell if the teacher is hung over? Movie Day.
Only one person in a million becomes enlightened without a teacher's help.
You never stop learning. If you have a teacher, you never stop being a student.
The greatest sign of success for a teacher... is to be able to say, 'The children are now working as if I did not exist.'

There's no question that a great teacher can make a huge difference in a student's achievement, and we need to recruit, train and reward more such teachers. But here's what some new studies are also showing: We need better parents. Parents more focused on their children's education can also make a huge difference in a student's achievement.

In high school, a teacher's friend in the police department asked me to go into a bar and flash a fake ID saying I was 21 even though I wasn't. They were assuming the bar wasn't carding people. Anyway, she forgot to ask for it back. I used it all freshman year in college.
Benevolence alone will not make a teacher, nor will learning alone do it. The gift of teaching is a peculiar talent, and implies a need and a craving in the teacher himself.
Music when healthy, is the teacher of perfect order, and when depraved, the teacher of perfect disorder.
